requirement_tested: Anonymous discussion forum with post creation and reply functionality
user_persona: A first-year student who wants to ask questions about campus life without revealing their identity.
user_goal: To anonymously post a question about dorm life and reply to another student's post.

narrative_steps.title: Creating Anonymous Post
narrative_steps.description: Alex visits the forum homepage and decides to ask about dorm life. They fill out the post form with a title and content, select a relevant topic, and submit.
narrative_steps.action: Fill in title and content fields, select topic from dropdown, then click Submit button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New post appears in the topic feed with a timestamp but no author information.

narrative_steps.title: Replying to Existing Post
narrative_steps.description: Alex sees another student's post asking about dining options and wants to share their experience. They type their response and submit it.
narrative_steps.action: Type reply content in the text area under the post and click Reply button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Reply appears beneath the original post in threaded format with timestamp, still maintaining anonymity.

requirement_tested: User authentication system supporting anonymous participation
user_persona: A shy sophomore who prefers to engage with the community without creating an account or logging in.
user_goal: To participate in discussions without providing any personal information or going through registration.

narrative_steps.title: First Visit to Platform
narrative_steps.description: Taylor opens the forum for the first time and immediately sees they can start participating without any login or registration process.
narrative_steps.action: Load the homepage URL in browser.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Website loads normally with no prompts for login or registration; session token is generated automatically in background.

narrative_steps.title: Posting Anonymously
narrative_steps.description: Taylor creates their first post without entering any personal details, relying on the system's automatic anonymous session handling.
narrative_steps.action: Create a new post using the standard form and submit it.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Post is successfully created and attributed to anonymous session; Taylor can continue interacting without authentication.

user_persona: A junior student looking for previous discussions about course registration deadlines.
user_goal: To find existing conversations about registration deadlines using search and browse features.

narrative_steps.title: Browsing Recent Posts
narrative_steps.description: Jordan lands on the homepage and scrolls through the main feed of recent posts to get a feel for current discussions.
narrative_steps.action: Scroll down the main post feed.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Additional posts load automatically as Jordan reaches the bottom, showing pagination working correctly.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Specific Topic
narrative_steps.description: Jordan remembers hearing about registration issues and uses the search bar to look for related posts.
narrative_steps.action: Type 'registration deadlines' into the search bar and press Enter.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Search results page displays relevant posts and topics matching the query terms.

user_persona: A senior student interested in staying updated on career-related discussions.
user_goal: To follow the 'Career Advice' topic to easily access new posts in that category.

narrative_steps.title: Discovering Topic to Follow
narrative_steps.description: Casey browses the topics list and finds 'Career Advice' which aligns with their interests. They decide to follow it.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to topics list and click the follow icon (heart) next to 'Career Advice'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Follow icon becomes filled, indicating successful subscription to the topic.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Subscription
narrative_steps.description: Casey wants to confirm they're now following the topic and checks if it appears in their followed topics list.
narrative_steps.action: Access the manage topics section from user menu.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: 'Career Advice' appears in the list of followed topics with an option to unfollow.

requirement_tested: Real-time notification system for followed topics and replies
user_persona: A graduate student who posted a question about research methodology and wants to know when someone responds.
user_goal: To receive immediate notification when someone replies to their post or posts in followed topics.

narrative_steps.title: Receiving Reply Notification
narrative_steps.description: Riley posted a question earlier and has the notification bell icon visible in the header. Suddenly, someone replies to their post.
narrative_steps.action: Wait for another user to reply to Riley's post.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Bell icon shows an unread notification badge, and a real-time alert appears indicating a new reply.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Notifications
narrative_steps.description: Riley clicks on the notification bell to see what alerts they've received.
narrative_steps.action: Click the notification bell icon in the header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dropdown menu opens showing recent notifications including the new reply, with unread indicator cleared after viewing.

requirement_tested: Backend API integration with PostgreSQL database using specified environment variables
user_persona: A developer setting up the platform for the first time on their local machine.
user_goal: To verify that the backend properly connects to the PostgreSQL database using the specified environment variables.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Backend Service
narrative_steps.description: Developer sets up the environment variables and starts the backend server to test database connectivity.
narrative_steps.action: Set environment variables DB_HOST=localhost, DB_PORT=5432, DB_USERNAME=myappuser, DB_PASSWORD=myapppassword, DB_NAME=myapp and start backend service.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Backend service starts successfully and establishes connection to PostgreSQL database without errors.

narrative_steps.title: Performing Database Operations
narrative_steps.description: Developer tests basic CRUD operations to ensure data is being properly stored and retrieved from the database.
narrative_steps.action: Make API calls to create, read, update, and delete posts through the REST endpoints.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Database records are created, retrieved, updated, and deleted correctly with proper data persistence.

requirement_tested: Frontend fetching all data dynamically from backend APIs
user_persona: A user accessing the forum from different devices and networks.
user_goal: To experience consistent content delivery regardless of device or location.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Dynamic Content
narrative_steps.description: Morgan opens the forum on their mobile phone and expects to see the latest posts loaded from the server.
narrative_steps.action: Load the forum homepage on a mobile device.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Page displays dynamically fetched content including recent posts, topics, and user settings without any hardcoded data.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting with Live Data
narrative_steps.description: Morgan creates a new post and immediately expects to see it appear in the feed without refreshing the page manually.
narrative_steps.action: Create a new post and submit it.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: New post appears in the feed automatically through dynamic API fetching, confirming real-time data updates.

requirement_tested: Privacy and security measures to protect student personal information
user_persona: A privacy-conscious student concerned about their online anonymity.
user_goal: To verify that their personal information remains protected while using the forum.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Anonymous Participation
narrative_steps.description: Quinn creates several posts and replies while checking that no personal information is associated with their contributions.
narrative_steps.action: Create multiple posts and replies using the forum interface.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All posts and replies appear without any identifying information linking them to Quinn's personal identity.

narrative_steps.title: Confirming Secure Communication
narrative_steps.description: Quinn examines network traffic to ensure all communications with the server are encrypted.
narrative_steps.action: Use browser developer tools to inspect network requests.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All API requests are made over HTTPS with encrypted session tokens, confirming secure communication.

requirement_tested: Theme configuration with honeydew background and dark olive green components
user_persona: A visually-oriented student who appreciates well-designed interfaces.
user_goal: To enjoy a consistent visual experience that matches the specified color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Pat loads the forum homepage and immediately notices the background color scheme.
narrative_steps.action: Load the forum homepage and observe the overall site appearance.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Entire site background is rendered in honeydew color (#F0FFF0) as specified in the theme configuration.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Component Styling
narrative_steps.description: Pat interacts with various UI components to verify they follow the dark olive green color scheme.
narrative_steps.action: Interact with buttons, forms, and navigation elements throughout the site.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All interactive components display dark olive green (#556B2F) styling for borders, text, or other visual elements.

requirement_tested: Database schema design for posts, replies, topics, and user preferences
user_persona: A database administrator tasked with maintaining the forum's backend systems.
user_goal: To verify that the database schema supports all required forum functionalities efficiently.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Table Structure
narrative_steps.description: DBA reviews the database schema to ensure all necessary tables exist with correct relationships and constraints.
narrative_steps.action: Query database information schema to examine table structures for posts, replies, topics, and preferences.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Tables exist with proper primary keys, foreign key relationships, and required fields as defined in the schema specifications.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Data Relationships
narrative_steps.description: DBA verifies that the hierarchical relationships between posts, replies, and topics work correctly in practice.
narrative_steps.action: Insert test data including posts with replies and nested replies, then query to retrieve complete discussion threads.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Data relationships function correctly, allowing retrieval of complete discussion threads with proper parent-child associations.

requirement_tested: RESTful API endpoints for forum operations (create, read, update, delete)
user_persona: A frontend developer integrating forum functionality into a mobile application.
user_goal: To successfully consume all necessary API endpoints for building a complete forum experience.

narrative_steps.title: Testing CRUD Operations for Posts
narrative_steps.description: Developer tests all basic operations for managing posts through the API endpoints.
narrative_steps.action: Make HTTP requests to /api/posts endpoint using GET, POST, PUT, and DELETE methods.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: API responds correctly to all CRUD operations with appropriate HTTP status codes and data formats.

narrative_steps.title: Managing Replies Through API
narrative_steps.description: Developer tests the ability to create and retrieve replies using the designated API endpoints.
narrative_steps.action: Make POST request to /api/replies endpoint and GET request to retrieve post with replies.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Replies are successfully created and retrieved with proper association to parent posts.

requirement_tested: Search functionality across posts and topics
user_persona: A research-focused student looking for academic resources shared in previous discussions.
user_goal: To efficiently locate relevant information using the platform's search capabilities.

narrative_steps.title: Performing Keyword Search
narrative_steps.description: Sam needs information about internship opportunities and uses the search bar to find relevant discussions.
narrative_steps.action: Enter 'internship opportunities' into the search bar and submit the query.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Search results display relevant posts and topics containing the searched keywords, with highlighted matches.

narrative_steps.title: Evaluating Search Relevance
narrative_steps.description: Sam examines the search results to ensure the most relevant content appears first.
narrative_steps.action: Review the ordering and relevance of returned search results.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Results are sorted by relevance with the most pertinent posts and topics appearing at the top of the list.

requirement_tested: User interface for managing followed topics
user_persona: A busy student who follows many topics and needs to organize their interests.
user_goal: To easily review and modify their list of followed topics through an intuitive interface.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Topic Management
narrative_steps.description: Taylor wants to clean up their followed topics list and accesses the management interface.
narrative_steps.action: Open user menu and select the 'Manage Topics' option.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Modal dialog opens displaying a list of all currently followed topics with clear unsubscribe options.

narrative_steps.title: Unfollowing Topics
narrative_steps.description: Taylor identifies several topics they no longer want to follow and removes them from their list.
narrative_steps.action: Click the remove/unfollow button next to unwanted topics in the management interface.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Selected topics are immediately removed from the followed list and no longer appear in the user's personalized feed.

user_persona: A student who wants to customize how they receive alerts about forum activity.
user_goal: To adjust notification settings to match their preferred level of engagement.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Notification Settings
narrative_steps.description: Jordan navigates to the settings page to configure their notification preferences.
narrative_steps.action: Go to user settings and locate the notification preferences section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Settings page displays checkboxes for different notification types with current preferences pre-selected.

narrative_steps.title: Updating Preferences
narrative_steps.description: Jordan decides they only want notifications for replies to their own posts, not for new posts in followed topics.
narrative_steps.action: Uncheck 'Notify me about new posts in followed topics' and save changes.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Preference change is saved successfully and Jordan only receives notifications for replies to their posts.

requirement_tested: Concurrent development setup with npm run dev for both frontend and backend
user_persona: A software engineering student contributing to the forum platform's development.
user_goal: To efficiently develop and test both frontend and backend components simultaneously.

narrative_steps.title: Setting Up Development Environment
narrative_steps.description: Alex clones the repository and needs to set up both frontend and backend development servers quickly.
narrative_steps.action: Run 'npm run install:all' followed by 'npm run dev' in the project root directory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both frontend and backend development servers start concurrently with hot reloading enabled for efficient development.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Concurrent Operation
narrative_steps.description: Alex makes changes to both frontend and backend code to verify that both servers respond appropriately.
narrative_steps.action: Modify a frontend component and a backend API endpoint, then observe the automatic reload behavior.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Both servers automatically reload and reflect the changes without requiring manual restart of either service.
